intro: Prostea pinnata, commonly known as the broadleaf pinnate, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Prostea pinnata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and vibrant floral display.
